sentences: Mõned isikud üritavad sundida teisi osalema illegaalses tegevuses.
Politsei võib sundida tunnistajat andsid üles.
context: The word 'sundida' in Estonian means to force, compel, or coerce someone to do something against their will. It often refers to situations where pressure is applied through threats, promises of good pay, or other means to make someone perform hard labor, participate in sexual exploitation, or engage in organ donation activities. This term is commonly associated with human trafficking contexts.
